meanings.definition: To crush into powder or small pieces
meanings.sent1: She grinds the coffee beans to make a fresh cup every morning.
meanings.sent2: The millstone grinds the wheat into flour for baking bread.
meanings.sent3: The noisy blender grinds the ice cubes for a refreshing smoothie.
meanings.sent4: Time grinds away at the ancient stone, shaping it into a smooth sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The relentless waves grind the rocks along the shore into fine sand.

meanings.definition: To rub together with a harsh noise
meanings.sent1: The rusty door hinge grinds loudly when opened.
meanings.sent2: The gears in the old clock grind against each other, creating a loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The car brakes grind as the driver tries to stop suddenly.
meanings.sent4: The windmill blades grind against the strong wind, producing a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent5: The skateboard wheels grind against the metal rail, making a screeching noise.

meanings.definition: To perform repetitive tasks or work diligently
meanings.sent1: He grinds through his homework every evening to finish before dinner.
meanings.sent2: The dedicated chef grinds in the kitchen, preparing meals for the customers.
meanings.sent3: The factory workers grind tirelessly to meet the production deadline.
meanings.sent4: The athlete grinds through intense training sessions to improve his performance.
meanings.sent5: She grinds away at her studies, aiming to excel in her exams.
